abstract: Nokia, which is trying to mount a comeback with Microsoft Windows phones, saw demand for its old Symbian phones — and its profit — plunge in the first quarter.
snippet: Nokia, which is trying to mount a comeback with Microsoft Windows phones, saw demand for its old Symbian phones — and its profit — plunge in the first quarter.
lead_paragraph: Nokia, struggling to reinvent its smartphone business around Microsoft’s Windows Phone software, said Thursday that it might have to cut prices of its cheaper Lumia models to keep its new phones competitive in some markets.

headline.main: Nokia Posts $1.2 Billion Loss as Phone Sales Tumble
headline.print_headline: Windows Phone’s Mixed Success Brings Little Relief for Nokia

abstract: Sales of Windows to consumers declined, but big businesses picked up the slack, Microsoft announced, with its earnings beating estimates by analysts expecting a drop.
snippet: Sales of Windows to consumers declined, but big businesses picked up the slack, Microsoft announced, with its earnings beating estimates by analysts expecting a drop.
lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Microsoft is facing some of the biggest challenges in its history with the rise of smartphones and the iPad, but one of its stalwarts of the personal computer era showed there is still life left in its main business.

headline.main: Microsoft Beats Estimates as Windows Makes a Stand
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Beats Estimates as Windows Makes a Stand
